title.value: Improving day-ahead Solar Irradiance Time Series Forecasting by Leveraging Spatio-Temporal Context
title.justification: This is the title provided at the start of the document, including the subtitle that explains the main contribution.
title.quote: Improving day-ahead Solar Irradiance Time Series Forecasting by Leveraging Spatio-Temporal Context

description: This paper proposes a deep learning architecture called CrossViViT for leveraging spatio-temporal context using satellite data to achieve highly accurate day-ahead time-series forecasting of Global Horizontal Irradiance (GHI). It also introduces a novel multi-modal dataset that combines satellite imagery with solar irradiance and other physical variables.

type.justification: The paper presents a new deep learning architecture and evaluates its performance using a novel dataset, thus focusing on experimental results and empirical validation.
type.quote: In this paper, we put forth a deep learning architecture designed to harness spatio-temporal context using satellite data, to attain highly accurate day-ahead time-series forecasting for any given station, with a particular emphasis on forecasting Global Horizontal Irradiance (GHI).

name.justification: The paper utilizes advanced deep learning methods, including transformers and multi-modal architectures, to enhance the accuracy of solar irradiance forecasting.
name.quote: In this paper, we put forth a deep learning architecture designed to harness spatio-temporal context using satellite data, to attain highly accurate day-ahead time-series forecasting for any given station.

name.justification: The primary focus is on enhancing the accuracy of time-series forecasting for solar irradiance by using a deep learning model.
name.quote: We present a deep learning architecture called CrossViViT, designed to leverage spatiotemporal context (such as satellite data) in order to achieve highly accurate medium-term (1 day horizon) time-series forecasting at any given station.

name.justification: Used for calculating the zenith angle of the sun, which is necessary for computing Global Horizontal Irradiance (GHI) from the BSRN dataset.
name.quote: The GHI component was computed using the formula: GHI = DN I × cos z + DHI where z is the zenith angle of the sun obtained from the pvlib python library (Holmgren et al., 2020).
